title: Rate of flow of water in a tank

content.question: A 12,000-liter tank of water is filled to capacity. At time t = 0, water begins to drain out of the tank at a rate modeled by r(t), measured in liters per hour, where r is given by the piecewise-defined function <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>r</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mrow> <mo>{</mo> <mtable columnalign="left"> <mtr> <mtd> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>600</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mtext>             for </mtext> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>5</mn> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mn>1000</mn> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>0.2</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </msup> <mtext>   for </mtext> <mi>t</mi> <mo>></mo> <mn>5</mn> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOCamaabm aabaaeaaaaaaaaa8qacaWG0baapaGaayjkaiaawMcaa8qacqGH9aqp daGabaabaeqabaWaaSaaaeaacaaI2aGaaGimaiaaicdacaWG0baaba GaamiDaiabgUcaRiaaiodaaaGaaeiiaiaabccacaqGGaGaaeiiaiaa bccacaqGGaGaaeiiaiaabccacaqGGaGaaeiiaiaabccacaqGGaGaae iiaiaabAgacaqGVbGaaeOCaiaabccacaaIWaGaeyizImQaamiDaiab gsMiJkaaiwdaaeaacaaIXaGaaGimaiaaicdacaaIWaGaamyza8aada ahaaWcbeqaa8qacqGHsislpaGaaGimaiaac6cacaaIYaGaamiDaaaa kiaabccacaqGGaGaaeiiaiaabAgacaqGVbGaaeOCaiaabccacaWG0b GaeyOpa4JaaGynaaaapeGaay5Eaaaaaa@63B2@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> (a) Is r continuous at t = 5? Show the work that leads to your answer.

frqParts.text: A 12,000-liter tank of water is filled to capacity. At time t = 0, water begins to drain out of the tank at a rate modeled by r(t), measured in liters per hour, where r is given by the piecewise-defined function <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>r</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mrow> <mo>{</mo> <mtable columnalign="left"> <mtr> <mtd> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>600</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mtext>             for </mtext> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>5</mn> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mn>1000</mn> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>0.2</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </msup> <mtext>   for </mtext> <mi>t</mi> <mo>></mo> <mn>5</mn> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOCamaabm aabaaeaaaaaaaaa8qacaWG0baapaGaayjkaiaawMcaa8qacqGH9aqp daGabaabaeqabaWaaSaaaeaacaaI2aGaaGimaiaaicdacaWG0baaba GaamiDaiabgUcaRiaaiodaaaGaaeiiaiaabccacaqGGaGaaeiiaiaa bccacaqGGaGaaeiiaiaabccacaqGGaGaaeiiaiaabccacaqGGaGaae iiaiaabAgacaqGVbGaaeOCaiaabccacaaIWaGaeyizImQaamiDaiab gsMiJkaaiwdaaeaacaaIXaGaaGimaiaaicdacaaIWaGaamyza8aada ahaaWcbeqaa8qacqGHsislpaGaaGimaiaac6cacaaIYaGaamiDaaaa kiaabccacaqGGaGaaeiiaiaabAgacaqGVbGaaeOCaiaabccacaWG0b GaeyOpa4JaaGynaaaapeGaay5Eaaaaaa@63B2@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> (a) Is r continuous at t = 5? Show the work that leads to your answer.
(b) Find the average rate at which water is draining from the tank between time t = 0 and time t = 8 hours.
(c) Find r'(3). Using correct units, explain the meaning of that value in the context of this problem.
(d) Write, but do not solve, an equation involving an integral to find the time A when the amount of water in the tank is 9000 liters.

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
